snippet: The National Bureau of Statistics announced that consumer prices were 2.1 percent higher in March than a year before. Prices had been 3.2 percent higher in February.
abstract: National Bureau of Statistics announces that Consumer prices in China rose less than expected in March 2013, as unappetizing and widely televised spectacle of thousands of dead pigs floating upstream from Shanghai pushes pork prices down sharply; consumer prices were 2.1 percent higher for month than year ago.
lead_paragraph: The National Bureau of Statistics announced that consumer prices were 2.1 percent higher in March than a year before. Prices had been 3.2 percent higher in February.

headline.main: Images of Dead Pigs Reduce China’s Appetite for Pork, Keep Prices Down
headline.print_headline: Images of Dead Pigs Cut China’s Pork Appetite and Keep Consumer Prices Down
